definition: to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
small/tiny/few/young
bewildering/odd/strange/uncanny/devil/monster/to wonder at/to blame/quite/rather

sentences.chinese: 這有什麼好大驚小怪的？

sentences.english: That didn't stop Chinese pundits from making a fuss over it.
sentences.chinese: 這並沒有阻止中國的博學之士對此大驚小怪。

sentences.english: To experienced software people, none of this is very surprising.
sentences.chinese: 有經驗的軟件人對此已經不覺得有啥大驚小怪的了。

sentences.english: The fact that my genius goes unrecognized saddens me, but no longer surprises.
sentences.chinese: 天賦得不到承認使我沮喪，但也使我不再大驚小怪。

sentences.english: Some of them were fussing, of course.
sentences.chinese: 當然，有些孩子會大驚小怪。

sentences.english: Children seem to have endless desires, which shouldn't be a huge shock.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們總是要這要那的，不必爲此大驚小怪。

sentences.english: She's always fussing about something or other.
sentences.chinese: 她對任何事情總是大驚小怪的。

sentences.english: It created a big fuss and the fuss persists to this day.
sentences.chinese: 它創造了一個大做文章，大驚小怪堅持到今天。

sentences.english: I said that a little too loudly, didn't I?
sentences.chinese: 大驚小怪的啊，一點也沉不住氣。

sentences.english: Watch what happens all of you left wing alarmists and thugs.
sentences.chinese: 看看什麼即將發生吧，你們這羣大驚小怪的左翼混蛋。

sentences.english: He saw nothing remarkable in asking her to come down lower.
sentences.chinese: 他並不認爲要求她屈就一些有什麼可大驚小怪的。

sentences.english: You win and lose in football so there is no need to make any drama out of it.
sentences.chinese: 足球場上有贏也有輸，沒什麼可大驚小怪的。

sentences.english: Don't make a fuss about such trifles.
sentences.chinese: 不要爲區區小事而大驚小怪。

sentences.english: You shouldn't get all worked up over such a little thing.
sentences.chinese: 你不應該對這種芝麻小事大驚小怪的。

sentences.english: Don't make so much fuss over losing pen.
sentences.chinese: 別爲了丟失踊支彼就這樣大驚小怪。

definition: to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
double standard
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
to talk nonsense/nonsense!
stingy/miserly/narrow-minded/petty
hard to understand/incomprehensible
to be confused/to be baffled
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
bad habit (e.g. nose-picking)/petty maneuver/dirty trick/gamesmanship
to have nothing to say (idiom)
to run around all over the place
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to lose face/humiliation
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
